revision.text:
[[File:Inconsolable grief.jpg|thumb|250px|Inconsolable grief by [[Ivan Kramskoi]]]]
'''Miscarriage and grief''' are both an event and subsequent process of grieving that develops in response to a [[miscarriage]].<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/> Almost all those experiencing a miscarriage experience [[grief]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://www.postpartumprogress.com/13-things-you-should-know-about-grief-after-miscarriage-or-baby-loss|title=13 Things To Know About Grief After Miscarriage or Loss|date=2013-05-16|work=Postpartum Progress|access-date=2017-09-09|language=English|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170909192535/http://www.postpartumprogress.com/13-things-you-should-know-about-grief-after-miscarriage-or-baby-loss|archivedate=September 9, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name=:2>{{Cite web|url=http://www.miscarriagesupport.org.nz/grief-issues-special-to-miscarriage/|title=Grief Issues Special to Miscarriage – the broken bond|website=www.miscarriagesupport.org.nz|language=English|access-date=2017-09-09|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170704235250/http://www.miscarriagesupport.org.nz/grief-issues-special-to-miscarriage/|archivedate=July 4, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> This event is often considered to be identical to the loss of a child and has been described as traumatic.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://hospicefoundation.org/Grief-(1)|title=Hospice Foundation Of America - Grief|website=hospicefoundation.org|access-date=2017-09-13}}</ref><ref name="lok">Lok, I. H., & Neugebauer, R. (2007). Psychological morbidity following miscarriage. Best Practice & Research Clinical Obstetrics & Gynaecology, 21(2), 229-247.</ref><ref name="buon">{{Cite journal|last=Bellieni|first=Carlo V.|last2=Buonocore|first2=Giuseppe|date=2013-07-01|title=Abortion and subsequent mental health: Review of the literature|journal=Psychiatry and Clinical Neurosciences|language=en|volume=67|issue=5|pages=301–310|doi=10.1111/pcn.12067|pmid=23859662|issn=1440-1819}}</ref> "Devastation" is another descriptor of miscarriage.<ref name="Nelson 380–392">{{Cite journal|last=Nelson|first=S. Katherine|last2=Robbins|first2=Megan L.|last3=Andrews|first3=Sara E.|last4=Sweeny|first4=Kate|date=2017-03-01|title=Disrupted Transition to Parenthood: Gender Moderates the Association Between Miscarriage and Uncertainty About Conception|journal=Sex Roles|language=en|volume=76|issue=5–6|pages=380–392|doi=10.1007/s11199-015-0564-z|issn=0360-0025}}</ref> Grief differs from the emotion [[sadness]].<ref>[http://www.thesaurus.com/browse/grief][https://www.powerthesaurus.org/grief/synonyms][https://books.google.ca/books?id=dF2WpFK3A5gC&pg=PA372 Some thesauruses consider 'sadness' to be a synonym for grief. See]</ref> Sadness is an emotion along with grief, on the other hand, is a response to the loss a of the bond or [[affection]] was formed and is a process rather than one single emotional response. Grief is not equivalent to depression.<ref name = beutel/> Grief also has physical, [[Cognition|cognitive]], behavioral, social, cultural, and philosophical dimensions.<ref name="auto1" /> Bereavement and [[mourning]] refer to the ongoing state of loss, and grief is the reaction to that loss.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/><ref name = loyd/><ref name = Robinson2014provision>{{Cite journal | title = Provision of information support to women who have suffered an early miscarriage (review) | first = Joanne | last = Robinson | journal = British Journal of Midwifery | date = March 2014 | volume = 22 | number = 3 | pages = 175–180}}</ref> Emotional responses may be [[Bitter (emotion)|bitterness]], [[anxiety]], [[anger]], [[Surprise (emotion)|surprise]], [[fear]], and [[disgust]] and [[blame|blaming]] others; these responses may persist for months.<ref name = sing/><ref name = aafp/><ref name=":5">{{Cite journal|last=Hunter|first=Amanda|last2=Tussis|first2=Lorena|last3=MacBeth|first3=Angus|date=2017-12-01|title=The presence of anxiety, depression and stress in women and their partners during pregnancies following perinatal loss: A meta-analysis|journal=Journal of Affective Disorders|volume=223|pages=153–164|doi=10.1016/j.jad.2017.07.004|issn=1573-2517|pmid=28755623}}</ref><ref name="Robinson2011dil" /><ref>Daniel Goleman, ''Emotional Intelligence'' (London 1996) p. 271</ref> Self-esteem can be diminished as another response to miscarriage.<ref name = sing/> Not only does miscarriage tend to be a traumatic event, women describe their treatment afterwards to be worse than the miscarriage itself.<ref name = jeve>{{Cite journal|last=Jeve|first=YadavaB|last2=Davies|first2=William|date=2014-07-01|title=Evidence-based management of recurrent miscarriages|url=http://www.jhrsonline.org/text.asp?2014/7/3/159/142475|journal=Journal of Human Reproductive Sciences|language=en|volume=7|issue=3|pages=159–69|doi=10.4103/0974-1208.142475|pmid=25395740|pmc=4229790}}</ref>
A miscarriage can often be "heart-breaking".<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Garrido-Gimenez|first=Carmen|last2=Alijotas-Reig|first2=Jaume|date=2015-03-01|title=Recurrent miscarriage: causes, evaluation and management|url=http://pmj.bmj.com/content/91/1073/151|journal=Postgraduate Medical Journal|language=en|volume=91|issue=1073|pages=151–162|doi=10.1136/postgradmedj-2014-132672|issn=0032-5473|pmid=25681385|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170910181311/http://pmj.bmj.com/content/91/1073/151|archivedate=September 10, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref> A miscarriage can effect the women, [[husband]], partner, [[sibling]]s, [[grandparent]]s, the whole [[family]] system and friends.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Johnson|first=Martin P.|last2=Baker|first2=Sarah R.|date=June 2004|title=Implications of coping repertoire as predictors of men's stress, anxiety and depression following pregnancy, childbirth and miscarriage: a longitudinal study|journal=Journal of Psychosomatic Obstetrics and Gynaecology|volume=25|issue=2|pages=87–98|issn=0167-482X|pmid=15715032}}</ref> Almost all those experiencing a miscarriage go through a [[grief|grieving]] process.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss>{{cite journal|last1=Robinson|first1=GE|title=Pregnancy loss.|journal=Best Practice & Research. Clinical Obstetrics & Gynaecology|date=January 2014|volume=28|issue=1|pages=169–78|pmid=24047642|doi=10.1016/j.bpobgyn.2013.08.012}}</ref><ref name=":1"/><ref name=":2"/><ref name="sing" /> Serious emotional impact is usually experienced immediately after the miscarriage.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/> Some may go through the same loss when an [[ectopic pregnancy]] is terminated.<ref name="auto1">{{cite web|url=http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Miscarriage/Pages/Causes.aspx|title=Miscarriage - Causes - NHS Choices|first=NHS|last=Choices|website=www.nhs.uk|date=2017-12-07}}</ref><ref name="webmd">{{cite web | last = Rosenthal | first = M. Sara | title = The Second Trimester | work = The Gynecological Sourcebook | publisher = WebMD | year = 1999 | url = http://www.webmd.com/content/article/4/1680_51802.htm | accessdate = December 18, 2006 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20061201085538/http://www.webmd.com/content/article/4/1680_51802.htm | archivedate = December 1, 2006 | df = mdy-all }}</ref> In some, the realization of the loss can take weeks. Providing [[family support]] to those experiencing the loss can be challenging because some find comfort in [[Psychotherapy|talking]] about the miscarriage while others may find the event painful to discuss. The father of the baby can have the same sense of loss. Expressing feelings of grief and loss can sometimes be harder for men. Some women are able to begin planning their next pregnancy after a few weeks of having the miscarriage. For others, planning another pregnancy can be difficult.<ref name=uk>{{cite web|url=http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Miscarriage/Pages/Complications.aspx|title=Miscarriage - Afterwards - NHS Choices|last=Choices|first=NHS|website=www.nhs.uk|accessdate=September 5, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170905055121/http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Miscarriage/Pages/Complications.aspx|archivedate=September 5, 2017|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name=misorg>{{cite web | url = https://www.miscarriageassociation.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Thinking-about-another-pregnancy.pdf | title = Thinking About Another Pregnancy | publisher = Miscarriage Association | accessdate = 4 September 2017 | date = 2013 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170905051002/https://www.miscarriageassociation.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Thinking-about-another-pregnancy.pdf | archivedate = September 5, 2017 | df = mdy-all }}</ref> Organizations exist that provide information and counselling to help those who have had a miscarriage.<ref name=uk/><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Meredith|first=Pamela|last2=Wilson|first2=Trish|last3=Branjerdporn|first3=Grace|last4=Strong|first4=Jenny|last5=Desha|first5=Laura|date=2017-01-05|title="Not just a normal mum": a qualitative investigation of a support service for women who are pregnant subsequent to perinatal loss|journal=BMC Pregnancy and Childbirth|volume=17|issue=1|pages=6|doi=10.1186/s12884-016-1200-9|pmid=28056861|pmc=5217635|issn=1471-2393}}</ref><ref name = whealth>{{Cite web|url=https://www.womenshealth.gov/pregnancy/youre-pregnant-now-what/pregnancy-loss|title=Pregnancy loss |website=womenshealth.gov|language=en|access-date=2017-09-18|date=2016-12-14 }}{{PD-notice}}</ref> Some women have a higher risk of developing prolonged grief and complicated grief than others.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Kulathilaka|first=Susil|last2=Hanwella|first2=Raveen|last3=de Silva|first3=Varuni A.|date=2016-04-12|title=Depressive disorder and grief following spontaneous abortion|journal=BMC Psychiatry|volume=16|pages=100|doi=10.1186/s12888-016-0812-y|issn=1471-244X|pmc=4830021|pmid=27071969}}</ref>
==Psychological impact== {{See also|Miscarriage and mental illness}} Miscarriage has an emotional effect and can also lead to psychological disorders. One discorder that can develop is primary maternal preoccupation. This is defined as a " ...'special psychiatric condition' in which the pregnant woman identifies with her baby, highlights the crisis a woman faces when the baby with whom she is preoccupied and identified dies..."<ref name="loyd" /> Grieving manifests itself differently for each woman after miscarriage. It may often go unrecognized.<ref name="loyd"/> The grief that follows a miscarriage resembles, but is not the same as, the grief experienced after the loss of a family member.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Brier|first=Norman|date=2008-03-17|title=Grief Following Miscarriage: A Comprehensive Review of the Literature|journal=Journal of Women's Health|volume=17|issue=3|pages=451–464|doi=10.1089/jwh.2007.0505|pmid=18345996|issn=1540-9996|citeseerx=10.1.1.473.673}}</ref> Disbelief, [[Depression (mood)|depression]], [[anger]], and yearning, are described as being a part of the normal grieving process.<ref name = kirs/><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Kinsey|first=Cara Bicking|last2=Baptiste-Roberts|first2=Kesha|last3=Zhu|first3=Junjia|last4=Kjerulff|first4=Kristen H.|date=2015-02-01|title=Effect of Previous Miscarriage on Depressive Symptoms During Subsequent Pregnancy and Postpartum in the First Baby Study|journal=Maternal and Child Health Journal|language=en|volume=19|issue=2|pages=391–400|doi=10.1007/s10995-014-1521-0|pmid=24894728|issn=1092-7875|pmc=4256135}}</ref><ref name = beutel>{{Cite journal|last=Beutel|first=M.|last2=Deckardt|first2=R.|last3=von Rad|first3=M.|last4=Weiner|first4=H.|date=November 1995|title=Grief and depression after miscarriage: their separation, antecedents, and course|journal=Psychosomatic Medicine|volume=57|issue=6|pages=517–526|issn=0033-3174|pmid=8600477}}</ref> These reactions remain from three to nine months after the loss. Forty-one percent of parents experience a normal, expected decline in grief in the first two years while 59% were delayed in the resolution of their grief.<ref name="kirs" />
Grieving can create feelings of [[loneliness]].<ref name=":0" /> This grieving has been called a type of [[psychological trauma]].<ref name="loyd">{{cite journal|last1=Lloyd Jones|first1=Sarah|year=2015|title=The Psychological Miscarriage: An Exploration of Women's Experience of Miscarriage in the Light of Winnicott's 'Primary Maternal Preoccupation', The Process of Grief According to Bowlby and Parkes, and Klein's Theory of Mourning|journal=British Journal of Psychotherapy|volume=31|issue=4|pages=433–447|doi=10.1111/bjp.12172|issn=0265-9883}}</ref><ref name="lok" /> Other serious consequences can develop including depression, [[anxiety disorder]], [[Posttraumatic stress disorder|post-traumatic stress disorder]], and [[Somatic symptom disorder|somatoform disorder]]. These responses all are associated with grieving after a miscarriage.<ref name="ce" /> Some women are able to complete the grieving process a few weeks after the miscarriage and start anticipating their next pregnancy. Planning another pregnancy is traumatic for others. The impact of a miscarriage can be "crippling" psychologically.<ref name="sing" /> Anger can be directed toward those who have had successful pregnancies and children.<ref name="lok" /><ref name="auto1" /> A woman can grieve the "loss of a future child" and question her own role as a mother.<ref name="lok" /> They may blame themselves or their partner for the miscarriage.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/><ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.webmd.com/baby/grief-after-miscarriage#1|title=Grief After Miscarriage|work=WebMD|access-date=2017-09-14|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=Robinson2011dil/><ref name=":6"/>
Unsuccessful attempts to become pregnant through [[In vitro fertilisation|in vitro fertilization]] (IVF) can also illicit a similar grief response in women.<ref name="Robinson2011dil">{{cite journal|last1=Robinson|first1=Gail Erlick|title=Dilemmas Related to Pregnancy Loss|journal=The Journal of Nervous and Mental Disease|volume=199|issue=8|year=2011|pages=571–574|issn=0022-3018|doi=10.1097/NMD.0b013e318225f31e|pmid=21814082}}</ref> Those experiencing a late miscarriage may have more significant distress compared to those who have experienced a miscarriage in the first trimester.<ref name="ce">{{Cite journal|last=Scheidt|first=CE|date=2007|title=Trauerverarbeitung nach Prä- und Perinatalverlust ( Mourning processing after pre-and perinatal loss)|journal=Psychother Psych Med|volume=57|issue=1|pages=4–11|doi=10.1055/s-2006-951906|pmid=17357028}}</ref> Even depression can occur.<ref name="loyd" />
"Women today...are aught in a unique historical moment: technology encourages them to form emotional attachments to their pregnancies, but society has not developed traditions to cushion the shock when those attachmets are shattered."{{sfn | Seftel | page = 62}}
Descriptions of the miscarriage are expressed in non-clinical terms by those who have experienced the event.
{| class="wikitable" !Descriptors !References ! ! |- |devastating |<ref name="Nelson 380–392"/> | | |- |shocked |<ref name = whealth/> | | |- |pregnancy loss |{{sfn | Softel | page = 57}} | | |- |lack of acknowledgement |{{sfn | Softel | page = 57}} | | |- |stunned |<ref name = whealth/> | | |- |not socially acceptable |{{sfn | Softel | page = 57}} | | |- |guilty |<ref name = whealth/>{{sfn|Seftel|page = 58}} | | |- |shame |{{sfn|Seftel|page = 58}} | | |- |sorrow |{{sfn|Seftel|page = 58}} | | |- |despair |{{sfn|Seftel|page = 58}} | | |- |angry |<ref name = whealth/>{{sfn|Seftel|page = 58}} | | |- |cheated |<ref name = whealth/> | | |- |numbness |{{sfn | Softel | page = 57}} | | |- |drowning |{{sfn | Softel | page = 57}} | | |- |envy |{{sfn|Seftel|page = 58}} | | |- |}
===Trauma=== Miscarriage has been found to be a traumatic event and a major loss for women.<ref name = jeve/> Pregnancy loss, including induced abortion is a risk factor for mental illness. The impact of miscarriage can be underestimated.{{sfn|Chritiansen| page=87}}<ref name=buon/> The trauma can be compounded if the miscarriage was accompanied by visible and relatively large amounts of blood loss.{{sfn|Seftel|page=60}} The trauma of miscarriage can be compounded if the miscarriage was accompanied by visible and relatively large amounts of blood loss.{{sfn|Seftel|page=60}} <!--==Risks==--> Bipolar disorders are associated with miscarriage. Depression and bilpolar disorder becomes evident after a miscarriage in 43% of women. Some women are more likely to experience complicated and prolonged grief than others.<ref name = kirs/>
==== Mental health ==== Women experiencing miscarriage are at risk for grief reactions, anxiety or depression.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/> Obsessiveness regarding the miscarriage can develop.{{Medical citation needed|date=September 2017}}{{sfn|Seftel|page = 60}} Primary maternal preoccupation is also considered a consequence of miscarriage. This condition can occur if a woman who develop a close bond "with her baby" experiences the loss of the pregnancy.<ref name="loyd" />{{Medical citation needed|date=September 2017}}
===Complicated grief=== Different grieving "styles" can exist and vary between individuals. There can be a complete avoidance of dealing with the memories of the miscarriage and there can be an "obsessive" concentration on an event in the miscarriage. This is in contrast with the expected ability to "reminisce about the loss of a loved one".{{sfn|Seftel|page = 60}} [[Prolonged grief disorder|Complicated grief]] differs from the more common form of grief that occurs after a miscarriage. The grieving process associated with other events such as the loss of a spouse or parent is expected to decline in predictable and steady rate. This not true for those experiencing grief after a miscarriage because only 41% follow the expected decline in grief while most, 59% do not fit this pattern.<ref name = kirs>{{Cite journal|last=Kersting|first=Anette|last2=Wagner|first2=Birgit|date=June 2012|title=Complicated grief after perinatal loss|journal=Dialogues in Clinical Neuroscience|volume=14|issue=2|pages=187–194|issn=1294-8322|pmc=3384447|pmid=22754291}}</ref>
===Stress and posttraumatic stress disorder=== Miscarriage is associated with post traumatic stress disorder.<ref name="buon"/><ref name=daug>{{Cite journal|last=Daugirdaitė|first=Viltė|last2=Akker|first2=Olga van den|last3=Purewal|first3=Satvinder|date=2015|title=Posttraumatic Stress and Posttraumatic Stress Disorder after Termination of Pregnancy and Reproductive Loss: A Systematic Review|url=https://www.hindawi.com/journals/jp/2015/646345/|journal=Journal of Pregnancy|language=en|volume=2015|pages=1–14|doi=10.1155/2015/646345|pmid=25734016|pmc=4334933|issn=2090-2727}}</ref><ref name = kirs/><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Bowles|first=Stephen V.|last2=James|first2=Larry C.|last3=Solursh|first3=Diane S.|last4=Yancey|first4=Michael K.|last5=Epperly|first5=Ted D.|last6=Folen|first6=Raymond A.|last7=Masone|first7=Maryann|date=2000-03-15|title=Acute and Post-traumatic Stress Disorder After Spontaneous Abortion|url=http://www.aafp.org/afp/2000/0315/p1689.html|journal=American Family Physician|language=en|volume=61|issue=6|issn=0002-838X}}</ref> Risks for developing PTSD after miscarriage are: emotional pain, expressions of emotion, and low levels of social support.<ref name= daug/> Even if relatively low levels of stress occur after the miscarriage, symptoms of PTSD including flashbacks, intrusive thoughts, dissociation and hyperarousal can later develop.{{sfn|Seftel|page=60}} The effects of stress can complicate miscarriage.<ref name = jeve/><ref name=":5" /> Miscarriage is a stressful event and because stress is a risk factor for subsequent miscarriage, its presence can become part of cycle that continues.<ref name="jeve" /> Lower stress levels are associated with more favorable outcomes in future pregnancies while higher stress levels increase the risk.{{sfn|Christiansen|page = 92}}
==Recovery== Physical recovery from miscarriage can have an effect on emotional disturbances. The body has to recover from the sudden pregnancy loss. In some instances f[[Fatigue (medical)|fatigue]] is present. [[Insomnia]] can be a problem.<ref name="sing" /><ref name="aafp" /><ref name="auto1"/> The miscarriage is very upsetting to the family and can generate very strong emotions. Some women may feel that the miscarriage occurred because they somehow had caused it. Others may blame the father or partner for the miscarriage.<ref name="sing" /><ref name=":4">{{Cite journal|last=Hale|first=B.|date=2007-01-01|title=Culpability and blame after pregnancy loss|url=http://jme.bmj.com/content/33/1/24|journal=Journal of Medical Ethics|language=en|volume=33|issue=1|pages=24–27|doi=10.1136/jme.2005.015560|issn=0306-6800|pmid=17209106|pmc=2598085}}</ref> Coping with a miscarriage can very greatly between women and families.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/><ref name = aafp/> Some find it difficult to talk about the miscarriage.<ref name = aafp>{{Cite journal|date=2007-11-01|title=Pregnancy Loss: What You Should Know|journal=American Family Physician|volume = 76|issue=9|pages=1347–8|url=http://www.aafp.org/afp/2007/1101/p1347.html|language=en|pmid=18019879|author1=American Academy of Family Physicians}}</ref><ref name="sing" /> The narratives of women tend to coincide with quantified and measurable effects.<ref name = loyd/> Some women engage in activities that are believed to aid in recovery such as therapy, [[religion]] and art.{{sfn|Seftel|page = 57}} <!--Interventions==-->Counseling can be offered but effective interventions to assist in recovery have been difficult to identify due to the reports of efficacy<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Neugebauer|first=Richard|last2=Kline|first2=Jennie|last3=Bleiberg|first3=Kathryn|last4=Baxi|first4=Laxmi|last5=Markowitz|first5=John C.|last6=Rosing|first6=Mark|last7=Levin|first7=Bruce|last8=Keith|first8=Jessica|date=2007|title=Preliminary open trial of interpersonal counseling for subsyndromal depression following miscarriage|journal=Depression and Anxiety|volume=24|issue=3|pages=219–222|doi=10.1002/da.20150|issn=1091-4269|pmid=16988939}}{{PD-notice}}</ref> and ineffective counseling. Comparisons are hard to make.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/><ref name="sing" /><ref name="ce" /> Despite the lack of studies that describe effective interventions for those with grief after a miscarriage, some clinicians still offer counselling and follow-up to help women recover and adapt to the loss.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Evans|first=Rachel|date=Jun 20–26, 2012|title=Emotional care for women who experience miscarriage|journal=Nursing Standard (Royal College of Nursing (Great Britain): 1987)|volume=26|issue=42|pages=35–41|doi=10.7748/ns2012.06.26.42.35.c9160|issn=0029-6570|pmid=22908762}}</ref>
Recommendations to help recover from the event include: * Turning to loved ones and friends for support. Sharing feelings and asking for help when needed. * Talking to the partner about the miscarriage. * Keeping in mind that men and women cope with loss in different ways.<ref name="whealth" /><ref name=":3" /> * Making good choices for health and well-being such as: eating healthy foods, keeping active, and getting enough sleep to help restore energy. * Joining a support group. A support group might help with feelings of being alone in the loss.<ref name="whealth" /><ref name=":3" /> * Doing something in remembrance of the baby. * Seeking help from a grief counselor, especially if the grief doesn't ease with time.<ref name = whealth/>
Generally, the impact of experiencing miscarriage is underestimated.<ref name="buon"/>{{sfn|Chritiansen| page=87}} Other methods used to promote recovery are be relaxation techniques, guided imagery, and "thought-stopping". Even Gestalt role-playing has been used. Some women can "emotionally relocate the child", redefine a relationship "with the missing child", and engage in "continuing the bond" to incorporate the loss into their life experiences.{{sfn | Seftel | page = 60}}
Women who have miscarried report that they were dissatisfied with the care they received from physicians and nurses.<ref name=Robinson2014provision/> One observer highlights the insensitivity of some health care providers when they approach the grieving mother "...by playing down her emotion as somehow an irrational response..."<ref name=":6">{{Cite journal|last=Christiansen|first=Dorte M.|title=Posttraumatic stress disorder in parents following infant death: A systematic review|url=http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0272735816300903|journal=Clinical Psychology Review|language=en|volume=51|pages=60–74|doi=10.1016/j.cpr.2016.10.007|pmid=27838460|year=2017}}</ref><ref name=":4" /> Clinicians may not recognize the psychological impact of the miscarriage and can "expect parents to move on with their lives."<ref name=":6" />
Since the experiences of women can vary so widely, sensitive nursing care afterward is appropriate.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Radford|first=Eleanor J|last2=Hughes|first2=Mark|date=2015-06-01|title=Women's experiences of early miscarriage: implications for nursing care|journal=Journal of Clinical Nursing|volume=24|issue=11–12|pages=1457–1465|doi=10.1111/jocn.12781|pmid=25662397|issn=1365-2702}}</ref>
==Children and concerns about future pregnancies== One emotional response to miscarriage is the strong apprehension that can develop anticipating a subsequent pregnancy.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/><ref name = sing>{{cite journal | publisher = Singapore Nursing Journal | title = The impact miscarriage on women's psychological well being and interventions: A literature review | first = Marianne | last = Wen-Yi | first2 = Lam | last2 = Ka Shun | first3 = Priscilla Jia | last3 = Ling Ho et.al }}</ref><ref name = aafp/> Procreation abilities may also be questioned by the woman.<ref name = sing/><ref name="lok" /> Significant distress can develop in the other children in the family when they think a sibling has died. They may regard this as a baby they did not get to meet. They can also experience grief and guilt find it difficult to express these emotions to their parents. The siblings may feel a need to act as if everything is the same and that they are unaffected in an attempt to protect their parents from their own feelings. Children can also need help, understanding and the ability to make sense of the event.<ref>{{cite book|title=Becoming Parents and Overcoming Obstacles : Understanding the Experience of Miscarriage, Premature Births, Infertility, and Postnatal Depression|last=Quagliata|first=Emanuela|publisher=Karnac Books|year=2013|isbn=9781782200185|location=City|pages=64}}</ref>
==Memorials and burial== [[Ritual]]s that recognize the loss can be important in coping.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Women's reproductive mental health across the lifespan|others=Lynn-Barnes, Diana|isbn=9783319051154|location=Cham|oclc=880941778}}</ref> Family and friends often conduct a memorial or burial service.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/><ref name=uk/> Hospitals also can provide support and help memorialize the event. Depending on locale others desire to have a private ceremony.<ref name=uk/> The religious faith of the woman and family impacts the grief process.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cowchock|first=F. S.|last2=Ellestad|first2=S. E.|last3=Meador|first3=K. G.|last4=Koenig|first4=H. G.|last5=Hooten|first5=E. G.|last6=Swamy|first6=G. K.|date=December 2011|title=Religiosity is an important part of coping with grief in pregnancy after a traumatic second trimester loss|journal=Journal of Religion and Health|volume=50|issue=4|pages=901–910|doi=10.1007/s10943-011-9528-y|issn=1573-6571|pmid=21861239}}</ref> Conversely, the lack of recognition that the miscarriage has occurred by family and friends can be troubling and add to the trauma of the event.<ref name=Keefe-Cooperman/> <!--==Narratives== Women discuss their miscarriage and interact with others who have had the same experience. This is one way that their loss is recognized, publically mourned and socially accepted.{{sfn | Seftel | page = 57}}-->
==In culture== Grieving after the loss of a child through miscarriage in other cultures can vary from western culture.<ref name="Klass2015">{{cite journal|last1=Klass|first1=Dennis|title=Book Reviews of Narratives of Sorrow and Dignity: Japanese Women, Pregnancy Loss, and Modern Rituals of Grieving|journal=OMEGA - Journal of Death and Dying|volume=70|issue=4|year=2015|pages=454–457|issn=0030-2228|doi=10.1177/0030222815573931}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://hospicefoundation.org/Grief-(1)/What-to-Expect | title=Hospice Foundation of America - What is Grief?}}</ref> An individual’s [[culture]] plays a large role in determining an inappropriate pattern of grief, and it is appropriate to take into account cultural norms before reaching a complicated grief diagnosis.<ref name="one">{{cite journal|last1=Shear|first1=MK|last2=Simon|first2=N|last3=Wall|first3=M|last4=Zisook|first4=S|last5=Neimeyer|first5=R|last6=Duan|first6=N|last7=Reynolds|first7=C|last8=Lebowitz|first8=B|last9=Sung|first9=S|last10=Ghesquiere|first10=A|last11=Gorscak|first11=B|last12=Clayton|first12=P|last13=Ito|first13=M|last14=Nakajima|first14=S|last15=Konishi|first15=T|last16=Melhem|first16=N|last17=Meert|first17=K|last18=Schiff|first18=M|last19=O'Connor|first19=MF|last20=First|first20=M|last21=Sareen|first21=J|last22=Bolton|first22=J|last23=Skritskaya|first23=N|last24=Mancini|first24=AD|last25=Keshaviah|first25=A|title=Complicated grief and related bereavement issues for DSM-5.|journal=Depression and Anxiety|date=February 2011|volume=28|issue=2|pages=103–17|doi=10.1002/da.20780|pmid=21284063|pmc=3075805}}</ref> There are cultural differences in emotional levels, how these are expressed and how long they are expressed. External symptoms of grief differ in non-Western cultures, presenting increased [[somatization]].<ref name="seventythree">Horwitz, A. V., & Wakefield, J. C. (2007). The Loss of Sadness: How Psychiatry Transformed Normal Sorrow Into Depressive Disorder. Oxford University Press.</ref> Narratives by Swedish women include their own perception of losing a child. Investigations describe their grief over their miscarriage: "When miscarriage occurs it is not a gore, an embryo, or a fetus they lose, it is their child. They feel that they are the cause of the miscarriage through something they have done, eaten, or thought. They feel [[Abandonment (emotional)|abandonment]] and they grieve for their profound loss; they are actually in bereavement."<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Adolfsson|first=Annsofie|last2=Larsson|first2=P. G.|last3=Wijma|first3=Barbro|last4=Berterö|first4=Carina|date=June 2004|title=Guilt and emptiness: women's experiences of miscarriage|journal=Health Care for Women International|volume=25|issue=6|pages=543–560|doi=10.1080/07399330490444821|issn=0739-9332|pmid=15354621}}</ref> Native American women have cut their long hair following the death of a family member.{{sfn |Seftel | page = 59}} The narratives of women tend to coincide with quantified and measurable effects.<ref name = loyd/> In women who are induced to have an abortion, an identical grieving process can occur.<ref name=Keefe-Cooperman>{{Cite journal|last=Keefe-Cooperman|first=Kathleen|date=2005-06-01|title=A Comparison of Grief as Related to Miscarriage and Termination for Fetal Abnormality|journal=OMEGA - Journal of Death and Dying|language=en|volume=50|issue=4|pages=281–300|doi=10.2190/QFDW-LGEY-CYLM-N4LW|issn=0030-2228}}</ref> The emotional responses to a spontaneous abortion (miscarriage) and an elective abortion are sometimes identical.<ref name=Robinson2014pregloss/> Spanish women experience grief in much the same way in the rest of Western culture.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Ridaura|first=Isabel|last2=Penelo|first2=Eva|last3=Raich|first3=Rosa M.|date=February 2017|title=Depressive symptomatology and grief in Spanish women who have suffered a perinatal loss|journal=Psicothema|volume=29|issue=1|pages=43–48|doi=10.7334/psicothema2016.151|issn=1886-144X|pmid=28126057}}</ref> Some women find online forums helpful.<ref name=":3">{{Cite journal|last=Sawicka|first=Maja|date=2017-05-01|title=Searching for a Narrative of Loss: Interactional Ordering of Ambiguous Grief|journal=Symbolic Interaction|language=en|volume=40|issue=2|pages=229–246|doi=10.1002/symb.270|issn=1533-8665}}</ref>
== See also == {{div col|colwidth=30em}} * [[Depression (mood)]] * [[Sorrow (emotion)]] * [[Joie de vivre]] * [[Melancholia]] * [[Mood (psychology)]] * [[Infant mortality]] * [[Miscarriage & Infant Loss Memorial Book]] {{div col end}}

'''NUST Business School''' ('''NBS'''), formerly known as the '''National Institute of Management Sciences''' ('''NIMS'''), is the business school of [[National University of Sciences and Technology, Pakistan]] (NUST). It is located in a purpose built building at the [[National University of Sciences and Technology, Pakistan]] H-12 Campus in [[Islamabad]]. It is located opposite to the [[NUST School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science]] (SEECS) building, across Scholar's Avenue.
==Mission statement== The NUST Business School official website states the mission statement as: "Our primary mission at NBS is 'to train and educate a class of business leaders who will learn cutting-edge technologies and practical business skills in a broader intellectual and ethical framework to respond to the challenges and opportunities of the ever-changing market place"
==Departments== * Department of International Business and Marketing * Department of Finance & Investment * Department of Human Resource Management * Department of Mass Communication * Department of Economics * Department of Public Administration
==Degree programs== NBS offers degrees in both Bachelors and Masters level.
*<big>'''Bacheors'''</big> ** [[Bachelor of Business Administration]] (Honors) ** BS Accounting and Finance ** BS [[Economics]] ** BS [[Mass Communication]] ** BS [[Public Administration]] * <big>'''Masters'''</big> ** [[Master of Business Administration]] (MBA) ** [[Executive MBA]] ** MS [[Economics]] ** [[Master of Philosophy]] (MPhil)
==See also== [[National University of Sciences and Technology, Pakistan]]
==External links== * [http://nust.edu.pk/INSTITUTIONS/Schools/NBS/Pages/default.aspx Official website]

{{Philippine name|Lualhati|Alcasid}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Ogie Alcasid | image = Singer Ogie.jpg | Spouse(s) =Regine Velasquez | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Herminio Jose Lualhati Alcasid Jr. | birth_place = [[Manila]], [[Philippines]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1967|8|27|df=y}} | origin = [[Calamba, Laguna|Calamba, Laguna, Philippines]]
[[Taal, Batangas]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter, Record Producer, Actor, Comedian, Parodist, Television Presenter | years_active = 1988–present | genre = [[Original Pilipino Music|OPM]], [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Novelty songs|Novelty]], [[Contemporary worship music|CCM]] | label = [[PolyEast Records|Octoarts, PolyEast Records Philippines]], [[Universal Music Group|MCA Music Philippines]], [[Viva Records (Philippines)|Viva Records]], [[Universal Records (Philippines)|Universal Records]] | spouse= [[Michelle van Eimeren]] (m. 1996–2007; annulled)
[[Regine Velasquez]] (m. 2010) | children = 3, including [[Leila Alcasid|Leila]] | website = [http://www.ogiealcasid.com/ Official website]}} '''Herminio Jose Lualhati Alcasid Jr.''' (born 27 August 1967), known as '''Ogie Alcasid''' is a [[Filipino people|Filipino]] singer-songwriter, television presenter, comedian, parodist, and actor. He is currently the President of OPM (Organisasyon ng Pilipinong Mang-Aawit) and Commissioner of the EDSA People Power Commission (EPPC). ==Early career== {{BLP unsourced section|date=May 2017}} Ogie is a former batch member of all male singing group ''[[Kundirana]]'' batch 1985 after [[Gary Valenciano]]. His first album was released in 1989. His debut movie was ''Feel Na Feel'' released by Regal Entertainment in 1990, followed by his 2nd movie ''Tiny Terrestrial: The Tiny Professors'' released by OctoArts films in 1991. The same year, Ogie made his VIVA films debut movie, ''Pitong Gamol''. ==Television career== {{BLP unsourced section|date=June 2015}} Alcasid's television career started as one of the hosts of comedy show ''Small Brothers'' on [[ABS-CBN]] in 1992. He appeared on other comedy programs such as ABS-CBN's ''Mana Mana'' (1991–92), [[Associated Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s ''[[Tropang Trumpo]]'' (from 1994–95), [[GMA Network]]'s ''[[Bubble Gang]]'' (1995-2013), [[Q (TV network)|QTV]]'s ''Ay, Robot!'' (2005–07), and a sitcom ''[[Show Me Da Manny]]'' (2010–11). He also branched out as a [[game show host]], beginning in ABS-CBN's ''Game Na Game Na'' in 1995 and the Philippine version of ''[[Family Feud: Philippine Edition|Family Feud]]'' on [[TV5 (Philippines)|ABC-5]] in 2001. He hosted [[Fastbreak]], a former basketball game show on IBC 13 in 2002 and ''[[Celebrity Duets: Philippine Edition]]'' on GMA. He was a host on ''[[SOP Rules]]''. He got his big break in ''[[Hanggang Kailan]]'', his first drama show, and also sang its main theme with [[Aiza Seguerra]]. In 1995, he moved to [[GMA Network]], leaving [[ABS-CBN]].{{cn|date=May 2017}} Alcasid is recently the judge in ''[[Pinoy Idol]]''.{{cite news|first=Archie|last=Dee Calma|title=Ogie Alcasid wants to have a baby with Regine but willing to wait for the right time|date=15 January 2008|publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal|url=http://www.pep.ph/news/16067/Ogie-Alcasid-wants-to-have-a-baby-with-Regine-but-willing-to-wait-for-the-right-time}} and hosted such game shows as ''[[Da Big Show]]'' and ''[[Hole in the Wall (Philippine game show)|Hole In The Wall]]''. In 2013, he left [[GMA Network]] and moved to [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]], where he first project under the channel was ''[[The Mega and The Songwriter]]''. In 2016, he returned to his home network, [[ABS-CBN]]. He joined Tawag Ng Tanghalan on [[It's Showtime (variety show)|''It's Showtime'']] as a judge and he was also a judge of ''[[Your Face Sounds Familiar (Philippine TV series)|Your Face Sounds Familiar: Kids]]'', replacing [[Jed Madela]], the judge of season 1 and 2 of the same show. Before he returned to [[ABS-CBN]], his contract on [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]] had expired. He later appeared on several [[GMA Network]] shows as a guest. He appeared as a guest on [[Yan Ang Morning!|''Yan Ang Morning'']], [[Sunday PinaSaya|''Sunday Pinasaya'']], and on ''[[Eat Bulaga!]]'' as a guest judge. He was a special guest in ''[[Sarap Diva]]'', hosted by his wife, [[Regine Velasquez|Regine Velasquez-Alcasid]], and the comedy show ''[[Bubble Gang]]'', where he recently a cast member until 2013 before his transfer to [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]]. ==Recording career== Alcasid debuted as a singer in 1989 with the release of his self-titled album. ''Ogie Alcasid'' reached [[Music recording sales certification|gold record status]], while his debut single "Nandito Ako" (I Am Here) was awarded "Song of the Year" by local radio station [[Magic 89.9]]. He has since released 18 albums, including a Christmas album (''Larawan ng Pasko''/Images of Christmas, 1994), a live album (''OA sa Hits (Live)'', 2002), and four greatest hits albums. He has received a total of twelve gold records, three platinum records, and three double platinum records.[http://www.ogiealcasid.ph Ogie Alcasid official website], ogiealcasid.ph; accessed 21 June Ambassador * Kapuso Foundation advocacy, Ogie – Regine celebrity Ukay-Ukay * Childhope Asia spokesperson ==Personal life== In 1996, Alcasid married [[Australian]] beauty queen [[Michelle van Eimeren]], who represented Australia in the [[Miss Universe 1994|1994 Miss Universe]] pageant held in the Philippines. The couple had two children, Leila and Sarah.{{cite news|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/04/03/15/look-ogie-reunites-daughters-michelle|title=LOOK: Ogie reunites with daughters with Michelle|website=ABS-CBN Corporation|date=5 August 2015|accessdate=5 September 2016}} In 2007, Alcasid announced that he and Eimeren had separated. On December 22, 2010, he married again, to [[Regine Velasquez]], at a resort in [[Nasugbu, Batangas]].{{cite news|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/208588/showbiz/pep/pep-all-is-set-for-ogie-alcasid-regine-velasquez-wedding|title=PEP: All is set for Ogie Alcasid-Regine Velasquez wedding|website=GMA revision.comment: Merge from [[Pick and pack]] and [[Order picking]] following unopposed 2017 proposal; overlap and duplication; see [[Talk:Order processing#Merge proposal]]
revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{tone|date=November 2008}} {{original research|date=November 2008}} }}
'''Order processing''' is the process or work-flow associated with the picking, packing and delivery of the packed items to a shipping carrier. Order processing is a key element of [[order fulfillment]]. Order processing operations or facilities are commonly called "[[distribution center]]s".
==Process== [[File:Forklift AGV with Straddle, courtesy of Egemin Automation Inc..jpg|thumb|right|Automated picking]] [[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 183-22350-0001, Berlin, Postamt O 17, Päckchenverteilung.jpg|thumb|right|Sorting packages according to destination]]
Order processing is a sequential process involving:<ref name="autogenerated1">D.F. Bozutti, M.A. Bueno-Da-Costa, R. Ruggeri, Logística: Visão Global e Picking, EdUFSCar 2010</ref>
*[[#Picking|Picking]]: consists in taking and collecting articles in a specified quantity before shipment to satisfy customers' orders. *[[#Sorting|Sorting]]: process that separates items according to destination. *Pre-consolidation or package formation : includes weighting, [[Packaging and labeling|labeling]] and [[Packaging and labeling|packing]]. *Consolidation: gathering packages into [[unit load|loading units]] for transportation, control and [[bill of lading]].
==Picking== [[Image:Sistema de preparación de pedidos pick to light.jpg|thumb|Person to goods picking assisted by conveyor belt]]
The '''order picking''' or order preparation operation is one of a logistic warehouse's processes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inventoryops.com/order_picking.htm|title= Order Picking: Methods and Equipment for Piece Pick, Case Pick, and Pallet Pick Operations|last=Piasecki|first=Dave|publisher=InventoryOps.com|accessdate=8 December 2012}}</ref> It consists in taking and collecting articles in a specified quantity before shipment to satisfy customers' orders. It is a basic warehousing process and has an important influence on [[supply chain]]'s productivity. This makes order picking one of the most controlled logistic processes.
It is one of the [[warehouse management system]] functions.
===Types=== Types of order picking include: * '''[[#Piece Picking|piece picking]] or picker to part method''': the order picker(s) move(s) to collect the products necessary for one order. This is commonly seen in distribution centres for retail chains whereby a shop will require a great many replenishment goods. A picker may pick all or part of the replenishment for one shop. * '''zone picking method''': each order picker is assigned to one specific zone and will only realize order picking within this zone. For instance, in an electrical retail environment, both small and large items may be required and a picker on an electric vehicle such as a powered pallet truck (PPT) or an order picker vehicle may pick large and heavy items whereas a foot picker may pick small and light ones from another part of the warehouse. Eventually the two picks are collated. * '''wave picking method''': ([[Wave picking]]) the order picker(s) move(s) to collect the products necessary for several orders * '''sorting systems method''': no movement of the order picker(s), the products are brought to him by an automatic system ([[conveyor system]], automatic storage ...). * '''pick to box method''':{{huh|date=November 2016}} The WMS direct the operator to pick the sku from a storage bin or a transportation box and to put it inside the shipping box or into a box assigned to the sales order.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://wms.com.es/picking-carritos-de-recogida.html|title=Pick to box procedures|last=|first=|date=|website=wms.com.es|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-04}}</ref>
===Technologies=== There are various ways in which a pick may be communicated to a picker: * a simple paper pick list, * an [[RFID]] terminal * a list of labels that list an item's location -one per item being picked * [[Voice Directed Warehousing|voice picking equipment]] * pick to light equipment * [[Automated storage and retrieval system|automated storage and retrieval systems (ASRS)]]. There are many types, but the basics are mini-load, mid-load and unit load. Each system is used to deliver totes, cases, cartons, pallets or inventory with unique physical profiles. Mini-Loads usually range up to 1000 lbs per load; Mid-Load up to 2000 lbs per load; Unit Load for pallets up to 5000 lbs per load. * An automated dispenser, in which products are pilled up and separated from each other, and then automatically released on a conveyor belt when required (obviously not applicable to all types of merchandise) * [[Augmented reality]]
Some of these technologies can also be used to make sure the picker picked from the proper location using [[barcode]] or [[RFID]] terminal or voice picking.
===Piece Picking=== Piece picking, also known as broken case picking or pick/pack operations, describes systems where individual items are picked. Operations using piece picking typically have a large [[stock keeping unit]], or SKU, base in the thousands or tens of thousands of items, small quantities per pick, and short cycle times. Examples of piece pick operations include mail order catalog companies and repair parts distributors. <ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=http://www.inventoryops.com/order_picking.htm | last=Piasecki | first=Dave | title=Order Picking: Methods and Equipment for Piece Pick, Case Pick, and Pallet Pick Operations | publisher= Inventory Ops Consultation | year=2012 | accessdate=1 May 2015}}</ref>
===Case Picking=== Operations that use case picking tend to have less diversity in product characteristics than operations that use piece picking. There are typically fewer SKUs and higher picks per SKU. <ref name=":0" />
===Pallet Picking=== Full-pallet picking, or unit-load picking, uses much simpler systematic methods than piece picking or case picking. However, there are many choices in storage equipment, storage configurations and types of lift trucks. <ref name=":0" />
==Sorting == '''Sorting machines in distribution''' {{expand section|date=October 2015}}
==Pick and pack== '''Pick and pack''' is a part of a complete [[supply chain management]] process that is commonly used in the retail distribution of goods. It entails processing small to large quantities of product, often truck or train loads and disassembling them, picking the relevant product for each destination and re-[[packaging]] with shipping [[label]] affixed and invoice included. Usual service includes obtaining a fair rate of shipping from common as well as expediting truck carriers. Pick and Pack services are offered by many businesses that specialize in supply chain management solutions. '''Case picking''' is the gathering of full cartons or boxes of product. This is often done on a [[pallet]]. In the consumer products industry, case picking large quantities of cartons is often an entry level employee's task. There is, however, significant skill required to make a good pallet load of product. Key requirements are that cartons not be damaged, they make good use of the available cube (space) and be quick to assemble.
[[Warehouse management system]] products create pick paths to minimize the travel distance of an order selector, but often neglect the need to maximize the use of cube, segregate products that should not touch or minimize damage.
==Factors== The specific "order fulfillment process" or the operational procedures of distribution centers are determined by many factors. Each distribution center has its own unique requirements or priorities. There is no "one size fits all" process that universally provides the most efficient operation. Some of the factors that determine the specific process flow of a distribution center are: * The nature of the shipped product - shipping eggs and shipping shirts can require differing fulfillment processes * The nature of the orders - the number of differing items and quantities of each item in orders * The nature of the shipping packaging - cases, totes, envelopes, pallets can create process variations * Shipping costs - consolidation of orders, shipping pre-sort can change processing operations * Availability and cost and [[productivity]] of workforce - can create trade-off decisions in automation and manual processing operations * [[Timeliness]] of shipment windows - when shipments need to be completed based on carriers can create processing variations * Availability of capital expenditure dollars - influence on manual verses automated process decisions and longer term benefits * Value of product shipped - the ratio of the value of the shipped product and the order fulfillment cost * [[Seasonality]] variations in outbound volume - amount and duration of seasonal peaks and valleys of outbound volume * Predictability of future volume, product and order profiles * Predictability of distribution network - whether or not the network itself is going to change * Presence of small volume distribution * Minimization of shipping costs
This list is only a small sample of factors that can influence the choice of a distribution centers operational procedures. Because each factor has varying importance in each organization the net effect is that each organization has unique processing requirements.
The effect of [[Globalization]] has immense impacts on much of the order fulfillment but its impact is felt mostly in transportation and distribution.
== See also == * [[Counter-to-counter package]] * [[Distribution center]] * [[Document automation]] * [[Shipping list]] * [[Warehouse]] * [[Warehouse management system]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://wiki.openbravo.com/wiki/Projects:Warehouse_picking/User_Guide Openbravo user guide]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Order Processing}} [[Category:Business process]]

{{EngvarB|date=April 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox publisher | name = Penguin Group | image = | parent = [[Penguin Random House]] | founded = {{Start date and age|df=y|1935}}
(as Penguin Books) | founder = [[Allen Lane]][http://global.penguinrandomhouse.com/company-history/ Company history], Penguin Random House | country = United Kingdom | headquarters = London, United Kingdom | keypeople = [[John Makinson]]
(chairman & CEO) | publications = Books | revenue = {{Decrease}} [[Pound sterling|£]]1.05 billion (2010) | imprints = | url = {{URL|penguin.co.uk}} }} The '''Penguin Group''' is a trade book publisher and part of [[Penguin Random House]]. It is owned by [[Pearson PLC]], the global education and publishing company, and [[Bertelsmann]], the German media [[Conglomerate (company)|conglomerate]]. The new company was created by a [[Mergers and acquisitions|merger]] that was finalised on 1 July 2013, with Bertelsmann owning 53% of the joint venture, and Pearson controlling the remaining 47%.Mark Sweney [https://www.theguardian.com/books/2012/oct/29/penguin-random-house-book-publisher "Penguin and Random House merger to create biggest book publisher ever seen"], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 29 October 2012 [[Penguin Books]] has its registered office in [[City of Westminster]], London."[http://www.penguin.co.uk/static/cs/uk/0/aboutus/index.html#question1 26. What is Penguin Books Limited's company registration number?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090711051613/http://www.penguin.co.uk/static/cs/uk/0/aboutus/index.html |date=11 July 2009 }}" Penguin Books. Retrieved 28 August 2009."[http://www.westminster.gov.uk/maps/ Maps] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110905100803/http://www.westminster.gov.uk/maps/ |date=5 September 2011 }}." [[City of Westminster]]. Retrieved 28 August 2009. Its British division is ''[[Penguin Books]] Ltd.'' Other separate divisions can be found in the United States, Ireland, New Zealand, India, Australia, Canada, China, Brazil and South Africa. ==History== [[Penguin Books]] Ltd. (est. 1935) of the United Kingdom was bought over by [[Longman|Pearson Longman]] in 1970. In 1975, Penguin acquired the American hardcover firm [[Viking Press]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1975/11/11/archives/viking-press-is-sold-to-penguin-books.html|title=Viking Press Is Sold to Penguin Books|last=Whitman|first=Alden|date=1975-11-11|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-09-13|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} In 1986, Penguin acquired the [[New American Library]], a mass-market paperback publisher.{{Cite web| last = McDowell| first = Edwin| title = PENGUIN AGREES TO BUY NEW AMERICAN LIBRARY| accessdate = 2018-12-02| url = https://www.nytimes.com/1986/10/01/garden/penguin-agrees-to-buy-new-american-library.html}} Penguin Group (USA) Inc. was formed in 1996 as a result of the merger between Penguin Books USA and the [[G. P. Putnam's Sons|Putnam Berkley Group]] after Penguin acquired Putnam Berkley from [[MCA Inc.|MCA]].{{Cite news| issn = 0362-4331| last = Lyall| first = Sarah| title = Penguin Is Buying MCA's Putnam Berkley for $336 Million| work = The New York Times| accessdate = 2018-12-02| date = 1996-11-27| url = https://www.nytimes.com/1996/11/27/business/penguin-is-buying-mca-s-putnam-berkley-for-336-million.html}}{{Cite web|url=http://nymag.com/nymetro/news/media/features/5618/index1.html|title=Now for the Grann Finale|website=NYMag.com|access-date=2018-05-23}} The newly formed company was originally called Penguin Putnam Inc., but, in 2003, it changed its name to Penguin Group (USA) Inc. to reflect the parent Pearson PLC's grouping of all the Penguin companies worldwide under the supervisory umbrella of Pearson's own Penguin Group division. The different Penguin companies use many [[imprint (trade name)|imprint]]s, many of which used to be independent publishers.{{cite web |url=http://us.penguingroup.com/static/html/aboutus/index.html|title=Penguin Group (USA): About Us}} Penguin Group (USA) Inc. also operates its own [[speaker's bureau]] that books speaking engagements for many of the publisher's authors. In 2011, the online writing and publishing community [[Book Country]] was launched as a subsidiary of Penguin Group USA.{{cite web|url=http://www.bookcountry.com/AboutUs/Penguin.aspx |title=What's the Penguin About? |publisher=Bookcountry.com |accessdate=27 February 2014}} In April 2012, the [[United States Department of Justice]] filed ''[[United States v. Apple Inc.]]'', naming [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], Penguin, and four other major publishers as defendants. The suit alleged that they conspired to [[price-fixing|fix prices]] for [[e-books]] and weaken [[Amazon.com]]'s position in the market in violation of [[United States antitrust law|antitrust law]].{{cite news | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/justice-department-files-suit-against-apple-publishers-report-says/2012/04/11/gIQAzyXSAT_story.html | title=Justice Department sues Apple, publishers over e-book prices | work=The Washington Post | date=11 April 2012 | accessdate=1 June 2014 | author=Mui, Ylan Q. and Hayley Tsukayama}} In December 2013, a federal judge approved a settlement of the antitrust claims, in which Penguin and the other publishers paid into a fund that provided credits to customers who had overpaid for books due to the price-fixing.{{cite news | url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2014/03/25/amazon-settlements-ebooks/6869033/ | title=E-book price fixing settlements rolling out | work=USA Today | date=25 March 2014 | accessdate=1 June 2014 | author=Molina, Brett}} In October 2012, Pearson entered into talks with rival conglomerate [[Bertelsmann]], over the possibility of combining their respective publishing companies, Penguin Group and [[Random House]]. The houses were considered two of the Big-Six publishing companies, prior to the merger,{{cite web|last=Edgecliffe |first=Andrew |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/eaf8eaaa-1eac-11e2-be82-00144feabdc0.html |title=Penguin and Random House in deal talks |work=Financial Times |date=26 October 2012 |accessdate=27 February 2014}} which became the Big-Five publishing houses upon completion of the combination. The [[European Union]] approved of the [[Penguin Random House]] merger on 5 April 2013; Pearson controls 47% of the publisher. ==Imprints== Penguin Group [[Imprint (trade name)|imprint]]s include the following:{{cite web|url=http://www.penguin.com/publishers|title=Penguin: Publishers/Imprints|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} {{Columns-list|colwidth=30em| *[[Ace Books]] *[[Alpha Books]] *[[Avery Publishing]]{{cite web |url=http://www.us.penguingroup.com/static/pages/publishers/adult/avery.html |title=Avery – Publishers – Penguin Group (USA) |publisher=Us.penguingroup.com |date=4 September 2001 |accessdate=27 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140105044548/http://www.us.penguingroup.com/static/pages/publishers/adult/avery.html |archivedate=5 January 2014 |df= }} *[[Awa Press]]{{cite web|url=http://www.penguin.co.nz/browse/by-imprint/awa-press |title=Awa Press | Penguin Books New Zealand |publisher=Penguin.co.nz |accessdate=27 February 2014}} *[[Berkley Books]] *[[Cartoon Network]] Books *[[Companhia das Letras]] (70%) *[[Dial Books]] for Young Readers *[[E. P. Dutton|Dutton]] *[[E. P. Dutton|Dutton Children's]] *[[Firebird Books]] *[[Frederick Warne & Co]] *[[G.P. Putnam's Sons]] *[[G.P. Putnam's Sons Books for Young Readers]] *[[Grosset & Dunlap]] *[[Hamish Hamilton]] *HP Books (found 1964, primarily an automotive book publisher){{cite web|url=http://us.penguingroup.com/static/pages/publishers/adult/hpbooks.html |title=HPBooks – Publishers – Penguin Group (USA) |publisher=Us.penguingroup.com |accessdate=27 February 2014}} *[[Jove Books]] *[[Ladybird Books]] *[[New American Library]] (NAL) **[[Obsidian (publisher)|Obsidian]] **[[Onyx (publisher)|Onyx]] **[[Roc Books]] **[[Signet Books]] **[[Signet Classics]] **[[Signet Eclipse]] **[[Topaz (publisher)|Topaz]] *Pamela Dorman Books *[[Pelican Books]] *[[Penguin Books]] *[[Penguin Classics]] * Penguin Press (founded 2003, for literary nonfiction and fiction){{cite web |url=http://www.us.penguingroup.com/static/pages/publishers/adult/penguinpress.html |title=The Penguin Press – Publishers – Penguin Group (USA) |publisher=Us.penguingroup.com |accessdate=27 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140213211558/http://www.us.penguingroup.com/static/pages/publishers/adult/penguinpress.html |archivedate=13 February 2014 |df= }} *Perigee Books *[[Philomel Books]] *[[Plume (publishing)|Plume]] *[[Portfolio (publisher)|Portfolio]] *[[Prentice Hall Press]] *[[Price Stern Sloan]] *[[Puffin Books]] *Razorbill *[[Riverhead Books]] *[[Sentinel (publisher)|Sentinel]] *[[Speak (publishing)|Speak]] *[[Jeremy P. Tarcher]] * TarcherPerigee{{cite web|url=http://www.penguin.com/meet/publishers/tarcherperigee/|title=TARCHERPERIGEE|work=penguingroup|accessdate=25 June 2016}} *[[Viking Press]] *[[Viking Children's]] }} ==See also== * The other "[[Big Five (publishers)|Big Five]]" English-language book publishers: ** [[Hachette (publisher)|Hachette]], [[Holtzbrinck Publishing Group|Holtzbrinck]]/[[Macmillan Publishers|Macmillan]], [[HarperCollins]] and [[Penguin Random House]] {{Cite web | url = http://www.fictionmatters.com/2010/03/05/who-are-%E2%80%9Cthe-big-six%E2%80%9D/ | title = Who Are 'The Big Six'? | publisher = Fiction Matters | date = 5 March 2010 | accessdate = 16 January 2014 }} * [[Amazon Breakthrough Novel Award]] * [[Bertelsmann]] * [[Pearson Education]] * [[Pearson PLC]] * [[Penguin Group (USA) Inc. v. {{Multiple issues| {{unreferenced|date=October 2010}} {{context|date=October 2010}} }}
A '''ringtest''' is part of an external [[quality assurance]] programme for a measuring method. Usually a reference institute sends identical samples which have to be analysed for special parameters to different laboratories. The industrial, medical or research [[laboratory]] gets a limited time with a deadline to send in the analysis results. The statistical evaluation and interpretation of the laboratories’ results is a great help for all participating labs as it opens the possibility to assess the quality of their analysis compared to other laboratories. For accredited laboratories (e.g. ISO 17025 etc.) the participation in ringtests is obligatory. Nevertheless, also non accredited labs take part in ringtests.
==Fields of application== * tests of medical parameters ([[blood]], [[urine]], [[biological tissue|tissue]] etc.) * food analysis * material analysis * [[paternity (law)|paternity]] testing (autosomal DNA markers, Y and X chromosomal markers, mtDNA sequencing)
==External links== * [http://www.aabb.org American Association of Blood Banks] * [http://www.dgrm.de German Society for Forensic Medicine] * [http://www.gednap.de German DNA Profiling Group] - [[Gednap]] – Commission of Institutes for Forensic Medicine and Federal State Police Science Labs * [http://www.isfg.org International Society for Forensic Genetics] with German, English, Spanish & Portuguese, Japanese, Chinese, French, Italian speaking working groups
[[Category:Quality]]

revision.text:
'''Roy Eaton''' (born May 14, 1930) is an American pianist and advertising creative. He is cited as the first black American prominent in the field of advertising.<ref name=bhm/>
==Life== The son of Jamaican immigrants, Eaton grew up in [[Harlem]].<ref name=bhm>{{cite web|last1=Edwards |first1=Geoff |title=Black History Month: an interview with Roy Eaton |url=http://creativity-online.com/news/black-history-month-an-interview-with-roy-eaton/148896 |accessdate=3 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120422153034/http://creativity-online.com/news/black-history-month-an-interview-with-roy-eaton/148896 |archivedate=April 22, 2012 }}</ref> His father was a mechanic and his mother a domestic servant.<ref name=am/> He took up classical piano when he was six<ref name=am/> and shortly after, in 1937, played at [[Carnegie Hall]], winning gold medal in a [[Music Education League]] competition.<ref name=ofc>{{cite web|title=Roy Eaton|url=http://www.oldfirstconcerts.org/artists/426/|accessdate=3 July 2014}}</ref> In June 1950, he won the first [[Kosciuszko Foundation]] Chopin Award. He made his concert debut with the [[Chicago Symphony Orchestra]] performing Chopin’s [[Piano Concerto No. 2 (Chopin)|F Minor Concerto]] under [[George Schick]] in 1951. He was reengaged to perform [[Piano Concerto No. 4 (Beethoven)|Beethoven’s 4th]] the following season, and also made his New York [[The Town Hall (New York City)|Town Hall]] debut in 1952.<ref name=ofc/>
His education included the [[City College of New York]], the [[Manhattan School of Music]], the [[University of Zurich]], and [[Yale University|Yale]]; he subsequently became a music instructor at the Manhattan School of Music.<ref name=am/>
He was drafted for two years into the U.S. Army at the time of the [[Korean War]], serving all of that time in a hospital radio station,WFDH in Fort Dix, NJ where he wrote and produced radio and TV programs.<ref name=bhm/>
In 1955, on leaving the Army, Eaton was taken on as a copywriter and composer at [[Young & Rubicam]], and in his first two years created 75% of all the music produced there.<ref name=bhm/> In 1957, physicians gave him a 10 percent chance of surviving an automobile accident in Utah that left him comatose and killed his wife of under one year.<ref name=am/><ref name=bhm/> He worked almost three decades in advertising, with Young & Rubicam, [[Benton & Bowles]] and later his own company, Roy Eaton Music Inc.<ref name=am>{{cite web|last1=Seida|first1=Linda|title=Artist Biography|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/roy-eaton-mn0000770691/biography|accessdate=3 July 2014|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6QnNr1VOl|archivedate=2014-07-03}}</ref>
In 1986, he returned to regular concert performance at Alice Tully Hall, in Lincoln Center with a unique program format, "The Meditative Chopin", a subsequent "The Meditative Chopin II" in 1987 and a third recital in the same hall in 1992. Eaton is a long-time practitioner of [[Transcendental Meditation technique|Transcendental Meditation]].<ref name=am/> Beginning in 1968. He was inducted into the Advertising Hall of Fame in 2010
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://royeaton.net/ Official website] *[http://foxnewsinsider.com/2014/02/06/preview-harris-faulkner-interviews-ad-industry-pioneer-roy-eaton Meet the Ad Industry Pioneer Behind Some Very Memorable Jingles], Fox News
{{authority control}}

revision.comment: bolding the "Hurun Report". since this is the main subject, creating a separate article for this topic should be considered, or changing the article's name to it while providing background info about Hurun's founder
revision.text:
{{Infobox person |birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1970}} |birth_place = [[Luxembourg]] |nationality = British |other_names = 胡润 (Chinese) |occupation = Publisher, accountant |known_for = ''Hurun Report'' |alma_mater = [[Durham University]]
[[Renmin University of China]] }} '''Rupert Hoogewerf''' (born 1970 in [[Luxembourg]]), also known by his Chinese name '''Hu Run''' ({{zh|s={{linktext|胡|润}}|p=Hú Rùn}}), is the Chairman and Chief Researcher of '''''Hurun Report''''', a research, media and investments business, best known for its "Hurun China Rich List", a ranking of the wealthiest individuals in China.{{cite web|url=http://www.mediaworksasia.com/publication/detail/000000043/page1/|title=Hurun Report|accessdate=2008-06-25}} A qualified chartered accountant, Hoogewerf worked for seven years at [[Arthur Andersen]], before launching ''Hurun Report''. Hoogewerf graduated in Chinese and Japanese from [[Durham University]] ([[St Cuthbert's Society, Durham|St Cuthbert's Society]]) in 1993.{{cite web|title=Durham First issue 30|url=https://issuu.com/durhamfirst/docs/dug2078_durham_first_30_web|website=Issuu|accessdate=6 May 2018|language=en}} He went to [[Eton College]].{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-13150500 | work=BBC News | title=Fascinating fortunes: Our rich list obsession | date=2011-04-23}} Hoogewerf founded the China Rich List in 1999 as an independent researcher.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/global/1999/1115/0223059a.html |title=China's 50 Richest Businessmen as compiled by Rupert Hoogewerf |work= Forbes|accessdate=2008-07-26|date=1999-11-15}} Other key lists produced by ''Hurun Report'' include the "Hurun Philanthropy List" (est. 2004), a ranking of the most generous individuals in China, and the "Hurun Art List" (est. 2008), a ranking of the top Chinese artists alive today, ranked according to their sales of art at public auction in the past year. The "Hurun Best of the Best Awards" (est 2005) are the annual awards held in January for brands targeting China's richest. "Hurun Report" launched the "Hurun Global Rich List", a ranking of the richest individuals in the world in 2012.http://hurunindia.net/lists/# "Hurun India" was launched in 2012 with the "Hurun India Rich List", the "Hurun India Philanthropy List" and the "Hurun Most Respected Indian Entrepreneurs Awards". Hoogewerf was awarded the "Person of the Year Award" in 2002 by ''Neweekly'' magazine and in September 2009 was presented with the [[Shanghai Television Festival|Magnolia Award]].{{cn|date=February 2015}} Named after [[Shanghai]]'s official flower, the Magnolia Award is the highest honor bestowed by the city on foreigners. == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.hurun.net/EN/Home/Index Hurun official website] * [http://www.hurun.net/EN/HuList/Index?num=06977BCCF872 Hurun China Rich List] {{Lists of billionaires|state=expanded}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hoogewerf, Rupert}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:English accountants]] [[Category:British publishers (people)]] [[Category:Media industry businesspeople]] [[Category:Alumni of Durham University]] [[Category:Alumni of St Cuthbert's Society, Durham]] [[Category:Renmin University of China alumni]] [[Category:Luxembourgian businesspeople]]

{{Infobox company | name = Selecta | logo = Selecta_philippines_logo.jpg | logo_size = 200px | caption = Current logos of Selecta ice cream (left) and Selecta milk (right) | type = | genre = | fate = | predecessor = | successor = | foundation = 1933 | founder = Ramon Arce, Sr. | defunct = | location_city = | location_country = [[Philippines]] | location = | locations = | area_served = | key_people = | industry = [[Dairy industry]] | products = [[Ice cream]], [[Uht milk|UHT milk]], [[margarine]] | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = [[RFM Corporation]] | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = http://www.rfmfoods.com
http://www.unilever.com.ph/our-brands/detail/Selecta/334702/ | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Selecta''' is a [[dairy products]] brand owned by [[Philippines]]-based [[RFM Corporation]] ({{Pse|RFM}}). Its [[milk]] business is operated by RFM Corporation, while its [[ice cream]] business is operated under a joint-venture with [[Unilever Philippines|Unilever Philippines, Inc.]] (known as Unilever RFM Ice Cream, Inc.). ==History== The brand's beginnings can be traced back to 1933{{cite court |litigants=Arce Sons & Company v. Selecta Biscuit Company, Inc. et al |vol= |reporter= |opinion= |pinpoint= |court=Supreme Court of the Philippines |date=January 28, 1961 |url= http://www.lawphil.net/judjuris/juri1961/jan1961/gr_l-14761_1961.html |accessdate= |quote=}} when Ramon Arce started [[Pasteurization|pasteurizing]] [[carabao]] [[milk]] near his home in Novaliches (then a part of [[Caloocan City]]), where carabaos were in abundance (Unilever RFM Ice Cream, Inc. would cite the brand’s foundation year as 1948.http://www.unilever.com.ph/our-brands/detail/Selecta/334702/). Arce began selling and distributing fresh milk in bottles using the Selecta brand name to residences, restaurants and offices. Soon after, Arce and his wife, Carmen, would come up with their own ice cream recipe made from carabao milk. These products became the foundation of the family’s Selecta business, which later included the Selecta restaurants and bakery. The Selecta business was continued by Arce’s children after his retirement in 1950. By the 1970s, Selecta’s carabao milk based ice cream and fresh milk became available in supermarkets. Its milk was packaged in glass bottles while its ice cream was packaged in gold colored tin containers. In January 1990, [[RFM Corporation]] acquired the Selecta brand from Arcecon Dairy Products, Inc. (successor-in-interest to the Selecta business) and established Selecta Dairy Products, Inc. to take over the production of Selecta ice cream. Under RFM ownership, the recipe of Selecta ice cream was improved and aggressively marketed, posing a serious challenge to then market leader, [[Magnolia ice cream|Magnolia]]. With its success, its ice cream recipe would eventually shift to cow’s milk. Much later, the gold colored tin containers would be changed to gold colored plastic tubs. RFM also introduced its own Selecta milk products which were made from cow’s milk. In January 1995, the family of Mauro Arce, the youngest son of Ramon and Carmen Arce, revived the Arce family’s original ice cream business under a new name, '''Arce Dairy'''. Its ice cream would continue to be made from carabao milk and packaged in gold colored tin containers, reminiscent of the original (Arce era) Selecta.http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/business/04/16/12/arce-family-serving-‘all-natural’-ice-cream-pinoys-1935 In 1999, RFM entered into a joint-venture with [[Unilever (Philippines)|Unilever Philippines, Inc.]] to take over the production and marketing of the Selecta ice cream business.http://www.dairynetwork.com/doc/unilever-enters-ice-cream-venture-in-philippi-0001 For this purpose, Selecta Walls, Inc. was established (now known as Unilever RFM Ice Cream, Inc.). The Selecta milk business continues to be operated directly by RFM Corporation. ==References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== * [http://arcedairy.tumblr.com/post/1183653099/the-arce-history The Arce history] ==External links== * [http://www.rfmfoods.com RFM Corporation] * [http://www.unilever.com.ph/our-brands/detail/Selecta/334702/ Unilever-RFM Ice Cream, Inc.] * [http://www.arcedairy.com/ Arce Dairy] {{Unilever}} {{Heartbrand}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Selecta (Dairy Products)}} [[Category:Companies of the Philippines]] [[Category:Food and drink companies of the Philippines]] [[Category:Ice cream brands]] [[Category:Dairy products companies of the Philippines]] [[Category:Unilever brands]] [[Category:Products introduced in 1933]] [[Category:Philippine brands]]
